intro: Tetramerium scabrum, commonly known as rough tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that typically have four petals. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Tetramerium scabrum is often found in disturbed habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
